interpretation.description: The model accepts ages between 65 and 80 years.
Number of pills taken per day (i.e. psychotropic or other). The range of values is limited from 0 to 5 pills.
Annual routine blood tests examined. Enter yes if examined.
Instability in walking and standing balance. Enter yes if present.
Any condition affecting the heart or blood vessels. Enter yes if present.
Type of physical activity. Select between 'None', 'Walk/Light activity', 'Intensive Activity'.

Berg Balance Scale score (baseline assessment) - A tool to evaluate balance in older adults. The model accepts values between 0 to 56. Greater score the better. Download the instructions paper for additional details, which can be found on the next section of the page.

Frailty and Injuries: Cooperative Studies of Intervention Techniques score (baseline assessment)- A tool to evaluate the static balance of a person, with a score range of 0-28. Download the instructions paper for additional details, which can be found on the next section of the page.

Short Falls Efficay Scale International score questionnaire (baseline assessment) - A tool to measure the related fear or concerns of falls. The score ranges from 7 to 28. Lower score indicates lower fear of falling.  Download the instructions paper for additional details, which can be found on the next section of the page.

Timed Up-and-Go test score (baseline assessment) - A tool to assess mobility and evaluate balance in older adults. Measurement unit is in seconds. The model accepts a floating point between 0 and 15 seconds. Less score the better.  Download the instructions paper for additional details, which can be found on the next section of the page.
Number of hospitalization days after the fall incident. Max value for each incident is set to 20.
Cause or mechanism of the fall. Select one option for each incident. If the cause is not in the list then enter the option 'other'.
Location of the fall. Select one option (either indoor or outdoor) for each incident. If the location is not in the list then enter the option 'other'.
Time of the day the fall occurred. Select one option for each incident.
